Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Relation/FieldSelection

Syntax Exp . Name
Types
Exp Exp . Name
rel[T1 L1, T2 L2, ... ] set[Ti]
Description Exp should evaluate to a relation that has an i-th field label Li that is identical to Name. Return a set with all values of that field. Name stands for itself and is not evaluated.
Examples 
rascal>rel[str street, int nm] R = {<"abc", 1>, <"abc", 2>, <"def", 4>, <"def", 5>};
rel[str street, int nm]: {
  <"def",4>,
  <"def",5>,
  <"abc",2>,
  <"abc",1>
}
rascal>R.street;
set[str]: {"def","abc"}
[Edit] | [New] | [Compile Course] | [Warnings]
